rationale: Procambarus alleni has been assessed as Least Concern. This species occupies a broad geographic range and is found in a range of habitat types. It is robust and tolerant of seasonal water conditions. While there has been a historical decline in this species, population numbers are stable at present and there are plans to restore the hydrology within some of its habitat. Further research is required to determine the abundance of this species, and to what extent it is impacted upon by threats within its range.
